intro: Curculigo prainiana var. prainiana, commonly known as the Prain's arrowhead, is a species of flowering plant in the family Orchidaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing in forest undergrowth. Its botanical interest lies in its unique morphology and its role in local ecosystems.
